snippet.title: GUILTY: Pilcher convicted of murder
snippet.content: TOWNSVILLE man Dane Andrew Pilcher has been found guilty of murdering his ex-partner Corinne Henderson by stabbing her 21 times with a kitchen knife. A Townsville Supreme Court jury returned the unanimous verdict of guilty at 3.53pm. The jury began deliberating at 11.30am on Friday after a two-week trial. Pilcher had pleaded not guilty to murder and his defence counsel . Pilcher took a taxi to Ms Henderson's Idalia apartment on the night of September 26, 2015, after seeing a photo of her at the races with her new boyfriend. Crown prosecutor Michael Cowen QC said Pilcher . Pilcher jumped through the kitchen window of Ms Henderson's third-floor apartment before stabbing her with a kitchen knife. She died after suffering 21 stab wounds to her face, neck and back.
